questions.question: What is vacation leave defined as in the staff orders?

options.c: Scheduled absence on full salary for recreation and/or rejuvenation
options.d: Leave without pay for medical reasons

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). (Traced back to section 7.4.1 Staff orders.)

questions.question: Who determines the rates of vacation leave for different grades of officers?

options.a: Permanent Secretary or Head of Department
options.b: Ministry with responsibility for the Public Service

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). (Traced back to section 7.4.2 Staff orders.)

questions.question: When must employees apply for vacation leave according to the staff orders?

options.a: At least one month before the leave begins
options.b: On the day they want to start the leave
options.c: After the leave period has ended
options.d: It is not specified in the staff orders

questions.notes: The correct answer is (a). (Traced back to section 7.4.5 Staff orders.)

questions.question: What does Recalled Leave refer to in the staff orders?

options.b: Cancelled leave due to service requirements
options.c: Extra leave granted for outstanding performance

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). (Traced back to section 7.4.10 ii Staff orders)

questions.question: Under what circumstances may Departmental Leave be granted according to the staff orders?
questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). (Traced back to section 7.5.1 i Staff orders)

questions.question: How long can employees carry forward accumulated departmental leave into subsequent years?
questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). (Traced back to section 7.5.6 i Staff orders)

questions.question: When can officers be granted Recreational Leave according to the staff orders?

options.a: After every completed course of study
options.b: Immediately following the completion of a course of study
options.d: Recreational Leave is not mentioned in the staff orders

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). (Traced back to section 7.8.6 i Staff orders)

questions.question: What is the purpose of Half Pay Leave according to the staff orders?

options.a: To grant employees additional paid vacation
options.b: To provide financial support during urgent private affairs
options.c: To extend the period of vacation
options.d: To allow employees to work half of their regular hours

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). (Traced back to section 7.10 i Staff orders)

questions.question: According to the Book of Rules, who has the authority to grant leave to members?

options.b: Officer in Charge of Police Establishments

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). (Traced back to section 4.2 Book of Rules.)

questions.question: What is the maximum duration of half pay leave that can be granted to a member?
questions.notes: The correct answer is (a). (Traced back to section 4.23 Book of Rules.)

questions.question: Under what circumstances can special leave be granted according to the Book of Rules?
questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). (Traced back to section 4.24 Book of Rules.)

questions.question: What happens if a member is unable to return to duty at the end of their leave period?

options.c: Extension of leave up to 6 days with proper authorization

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). (Traced back to section 4.25 Book of Rules.)

questions.question: According to the Book of Rules, how is the grant of leave affected if a member has official correspondence or accounts pending?

options.b: Leave is not allowed until pending matters are resolved
options.d: Leave is extended to accommodate pending matters

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). (Traced back to section 4.5 Book of Rules.)

questions.question: What is the procedure for applying for leave, as per the Book of Rules?

options.b: Submit a typed application in triplicate at least two (2) months prior to the proposed date of commencement
options.c: Send an email to the Commissioner
options.d: Use a telegraph, telephone, or radio in case of emergency

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). (Traced back to section 4.11 Book of Rules.)

questions.question: What is the consequence of non-reporting of illness for non-performance of duty according to the Book of Rules?

options.d: Claim of illness will not be entertained unless promptly reported and supported by a Medical Certificate within 48 hours

questions.notes: The correct answer is (d). (Traced back to section 4.10 Book of Rules.)

questions.question: How does the Book of Rules address leave in respect of injury sustained while on duty?

options.c: Full pay sick leave not exceeding 28 days
options.d: Special consideration for leave without medical certification

questions.notes: The correct answer is (a). (Traced back to section 4.21 Book of Rules.)

questions.question: What is the maximum duration of special sick leave on full pay that can be granted according to the Book of Rules?
questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). (Traced back to section 4.22(b) Book of Rules.)

questions.question: According to the Book of Rules, who is responsible for granting extensions of leave?

options.b: Officer in Charge of the Division.
options.d: The Permanent Secretary of the Ministry

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). (Traced back to section 4.26 Book of Rules.)
